channel.title: Where do I find data_source_id
channel.description: I am trying to use libraries to run ReDash queries, a lot of libraries are using data_source_id but I am not sure where to get that value. Also, does anyone know a good JS library that works with ReDash API's? all the ones I have used are python.

item.title: Where do I find data_source_id
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Looks like this one is being maintained. Use with caution:

npm

redash-js-client

[![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/redash-js-client.svg)](https://npmjs.org/package/redash-js-client) [![Downloads/week](https://img.shields.io/npm/dw/redash-js-client.svg)](https://npmjs.org/package/redash-js-client)...

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I find data_source_id
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Data source ID’s are visible on the /api/data_sources endpoint.

From within the web app you can see the id in your URL bar when you view the data source settings screen.

We don’t maintain a redash api wrapper for JS. Maybe we should?

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I find data_source_id
item.dc:creator: mbajwa2
item.description:
I am trying to use libraries to run ReDash queries, a lot of libraries are using data_source_id but I am not sure where to get that value.
Also, does anyone know a good JS library that works with ReDash API’s? all the ones I have used are python.
